docblock.description: Plugin Name: Capitularia Collation Tool Plugin URI: Description: Collates TEI files.
docblock.long-description:
Version: 0.2.2 Author: Marcello Perathoner Author URI: License: GPLv2 or later Text Domain: cap-collation Domain Path: /languages
Capitularia Collation Tool plugin.
The *Collation Tool plugin* lets any member of the general public do collations of arbitrary sections from different manuscripts.
This plugin provides a shortcode that inserts a dashboard on the page. Within the dashboard the user can request collations of sections of manuscripts. The dashboard is implemented in javascript with Vue.js. The PHP code of this plugin basically only serves the Javascript code to the user.
The actual collation is done on the Capitularia API Server with the `super collator <https://github.com/cceh/super-collator>`_ library.
A big `Makefile <makefile>`_, run by cron on the API server, uses XSLT and Saxon to extract the relevant sections from the TEI files and pre-processes them for collation. In the end all TEI tags are removed and only the normalized text is stored into the Postgres database. On an incoming collation request the API server reads the pre-processed texts from the database and sends them to the super collator.
See: :mod:`collatex_server`, :ref:`collation overview<collation-tool-overview>`.

docblock.description: The Text Domain of the plugin.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class or function name without namespace

docblock.description: Enqueue the front page script and localize it.
docblock.long-description: The script is a webpacked Vue.js application containing its own css.

docblock.description: Replace the shortcode with the collation dashboard.
docblock.long-description: Insert a Vue.js component. Vue.js takes over from that and builds the collation dashboard.

docblock.description: Plugin Name: Capitularia Dynamic Menu Plugin URI: Description: Build navigation menus from user-specified HTML-tags.
docblock.long-description:
Version: 0.1.0 Author: Marcello Perathoner Author URI: License: GPLv2 or later Text Domain: cap-dynamic-menu Domain Path: /languages
Capitularia Dynamic Menu plugin.
The *Dynamic Menu plugin* provides a navigation menu for the sidebar. The menu entries are collected from DOM elements and attributes of the HTML page and allow the user to navigate to portions of the document. The menu entries may be nested.
You may configure the menu with xpath expressions, eg.to build a menu from all <h3>, <h4>, and <h5> tags on the page. The menu entries will be properly nested.
The PHP code only outputs a placeholder tag. The Javascript code will build the actual menu using the DOM of the page.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The class or function name without namespace

docblock.description: Enqueue Javascript and CSS for the front page.

docblock.long-description: Puts the item description into the HTML attribute data-cap-dynamic-menu. Otherwise it would get lost.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Depth of menu item. Used for padding.

parse_markers.error: Tag "see" with body "@see src/js/front.js for more information." has error "\cceh\capitularia\dynamic_menu\src/js/front.js" is not a valid Fqsen.

docblock.description: Plugin Name: Capitularia File Includer Plugin URI: Description: Includes external HTML files in Wordpress pages.
docblock.long-description:
Version: 0.1.0 Author: Marcello Perathoner Author URI: License: GPLv2 or later Text Domain: cap-file-includer Domain Path: /languages
Capitularia File Includer plugin.
The *File Includer plugin* registers a Wordpress shortcode that allows to include any external HTML file in a Worpdress page. We use this shortcode to put the transcribed manuscripts into Wordpress.
The TEI files are :ref:`transformed into HTML files <html-generation-overview>` on the Capitularia VM. On that server we maintain up-to-date python and java installations. A customary Web Projekt at uni-koeln.de does not include those or includes outdated versions of them.
This plugin also stores the included text into the Wordpress database. This makes the built-in Wordpress search function work with the included material.
.. note:: Currently (Nov. 2019) the plugin also does some post-processing of the HTML files. This code will also be rewritten and moved to the VM.
The format of the shortcode is:
.. code::
[cap_include path="path/to/file.html" post="true"]
:param str path: Path of the file to include, relative to the root on the settings page. :param str post: Optional. If the included file should be post-processed by the footnotes-post-processor then set this parameter to true.
See also: the :ref:`Page Generator plugin <page-generator>`, which generates batches of page stubs from directories of TEI files. Those stubs usually contain the shortcodes for this plugin.

docblock.description: The Text Domain of the plugin.
The Wordpress ID of the settings (option) page.

docblock.long-description:
One difficulty is to get in early enough so that the qtranslate-x plugin has not translated away the unwanted languages. We need all languages to be there when we have to save the page. qtranslate-x hooks into 'the_posts' so we must too. The other difficulty is to protect the included content from the wpautop and wptexturizer filters, which were implemented with boundless incompetence and try to put

's around the included content everywhere and fuck up the HTML attributes with curly quotes. To get around those filters we insert 

 tags around the included content,
which is the only way to fend those filters off for some portion of a page,
instead of disabling them wholesale.  We double the 
 tags in this way:

...
 so that we can filter them out again later without
danger of removing tags of other provenience.

We have to save the included content to the database to make it searchable by
the built-in Wordpress search engine.

docblock.description: Do we have to save the post?
A ref to the post being processed.
Process our shortcodes. Step 1: Include the file.
docblock.long-description: Called very early from on_the_posts ().

tag.name: return
tag.description: The content to insert into the shortcode.

docblock.long-description: Called after wpautop and wptexturizer did their nefarious work. Clean up the <pre> tags we inserted only to protect against them.

We are forced to hook into 'the_posts' because the qtranslate-x plugin does it this way and we must get in before qtranslate-x has translated away the unwanted languages.
We cannot save inside the on_shortcode_early hook because there may be more than one shortcode on the page and besides there may be other content too.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The array of posts with our shortcode processed.

docblock.long-description: Found in Wordpress admin under :menuselection:`Settings | Capitularia File Includer`.

docblock.long-description:
This script processes the output of the xslt transformation. Here we do those things that are easier in PHP than in XSLT:
- Merge adjacent footnotes and move footnotes to the end of the word. - Drop footnotes followed by an editorial note in the same word. - Insert footnote refs and backrefs and numbers them sequentially. - Wrap initials (dropcaps) and the following word into a span. - Substitute editors' shortcuts with proper mediaeval punctuation. - Accept XML or HTML input, always output HTML.
This file only declares symbols (classes, functions, constants) in accordance with PSR-2.

tag.name: return
tag.description: true if the node is a note.

The main difficulty here is to get around the wpautop and wptexturizer filters that were implemented with boundless incompetence.

docblock.description: Plugin Name: Capitularia Library Plugin URI: Description: Library of functions for Capitularia plugins. (REQUIRED) Version: 0.1.0 Author: Marcello Perathoner Author URI: License: GPLv2 or later Text Domain: cap-lib Domain Path: /languages

Capitularia Library plugin.
The *Library plugin* contains a collection of useful functions. This plugin bundles all functions that don't quite fit elsewhere or would be excessively duplicated.
This plugin is required by the other Capitularia plugins.

docblock.description: Parse a query string in a standard-compliant way.
docblock.long-description: PHP's parse_str function does not process query strings in the standard way, when it comes to duplicate fields. If multiple fields of the same name exist in a query string, every other web processing language would read them into an array, but PHP silently overwrites them. This function handles them in a sane way.

docblock.description: Plugin Name: Capitularia Meta Search Plugin URI: Description: Perform metadata-aware searches for and in TEI files.
docblock.long-description:
Version: 0.2.0 Author: Marcello Perathoner Author URI: License: GPLv2 or later Text Domain: cap-meta-search Domain Path: /languages
TEI Metadata Search plugin.
The *Meta Search plugin* offers metadata-aware and fuzzy fulltext search. A search form widget is part of the plugin. This search box is used on all manuscript pages.
The meta search uses a different approach than the built-in Wordpress search. This search is done on the VM server and the unit of search is the capitulary chapter. It lets you filter by metadata such as capitularies contained, dates, and place of origin.
The plugin also provides a snippet and highlighter class for the built-in Wordpress search, that displays snippets of text around the found terms instead of the page excerpt. The highlighter may be used on any Wordpress page.
See: :mod:`data_server`, :ref:`fulltext-search-overview`.

docblock.description: The text domain of the plugin.
The URL query parameter to request word highlighting.
This class provides a snippet view and highlighted search terms for the built-in Wordpress search. It displays snippets of text around the found terms instead of the page excerpt.
Get start and end of snippet
docblock.long-description: Given a match returns the start offset (strpos) and end offset of the snippet in the post content.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Begin and end of the snippet.

docblock.long-description: Given a regex, search a post and return a list of snippets. The snippets contain the highlighted search term and a few words of context. If two snippets do overlap they are merged. Snippets are returned formatted as HTML unordered list.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The max. no. of snippets to return

docblock.long-description: Escapes a search term so that preg_* functions can safely use it. '#' is the preg separator, eg. #term#u .
Build an excerpt using snippets with highlighted search results.

docblock.description: Highlight the search terms in the post.
docblock.long-description:
Highlight the full post if we came through the search page. We use the query string in the HTTP referrer to highlight the content.
The naive approach:
return preg_replace ($regex, '<mark>${0}</mark>', $content);
did not work because we were also replacing text in HTML tags and attributes. This whole rigmarole is needed so we can parse the content as HTML and then search the text nodes only.

docblock.description: Capitularia Meta Search search box widget

The result returned by the App server
Runs the meta query on the Capitularia VM server.
docblock.long-description:
Runs the meta query on the server, which returns the ids of the manuscripts that contain the search terms. Then builds a Wordpress query that searches for the pages that contain those manuscripts.
Then the program flow goes back to the normal Wordpress search page, except that we also provide the snippets to display and the chapter information.

docblock.description: Get the excerpt for the search result
docblock.long-description: Return the excerpt generated by the VM Server.

docblock.long-description: Generate a string like "BK.123 not before 950 and 'Karl'". This hook is called from the search.php page, and serves to insert the text outside our widget.

Plugin Name: Capitularia Page Generator Plugin URI: Description: Generate Wordpress pages for our TEI files.
docblock.long-description:
Version: 0.1.1 Author: Marcello Perathoner Author URI: License: GPLv2 or later Text Domain: cap-page-generator Domain Path: /languages
Capitularia Page Generator plugin.
The *Page Generator* plugin helps managing the publication of manuscript pages. Whenever a new manuscript is transcribed and its file is put into the file repository, a new Wordpress page needs to be made for the manuscript to actually appear in Wordpress.
This plugin lets you choose among a configurable set of source directories. Then it displays a list of the TEI files in that directory and lets you create and manage the page for each file. Bulk actions allow you to manage the pages in batches.
The plugin can be configured to automatically put some text on newly created pages. Usually this text consists in one or more shortcodes for the :ref:`Capitularia File Includer plugin <file-includer>`. It is the File Includer plugin that actually puts the content onto the page.
Note that this plugin does nothing on the public pages (except displaying a button on the admin toolbar).
How do the TEI files get to the user?
A cron process on the API server converts all the TEI files into HTML files and stores them in the filesystem. See also: :ref:`makefile`.
The :ref:`Capitularia File Includer plugin <file-includer>` then includes those files from the filesystem when outputting a Wordpress page to the user.

docblock.description: The Wordpress ID of the settings (option) page.
The Wordpress ID of the dashboard page.
Array of options retrieved from database and cached.

docblock.long-description: If we setup the options in the constructor it will be too early for translation to kick in.

docblock.description: Check if a certain page status is allowed in this section.

docblock.long-description:
The dashboard page controls the plugin.
You open the dashboard page by clicking on :menuselection:`Dashboard | Capitularia Page Generator` in the Wordpress admin page.
Outputs bare jQuery-UI tabs. They get filled by AJAX. Also outputs messages we get thru AJAX.

docblock.description: Format error message as HTML snippet.
docblock.long-description: These notices get inserted at the top of the dashboard page. The user can click on the cross icon to dismiss the notice.

docblock.long-description: The reason we use JSON instead of just sending HTML is that we want to send both, HTML and success / error messages. A table update is sent as a JSON string of HTML table rows that simply replace the old table rows. We assume for now that the user dashboard changes only on successful operations.

Classes set according to current page status. To colorize our table rows in the canonical way we use the same classes as Wordpress admin notices.

Called by the base class.

docblock.long-description: These are the links that appear when hovering over the table row. Clicking on the link initiates an Ajax request that performs the action and automagically redraws the table.

This class represents TEI manuscripts stored in a directory on disk. It also manages manuscripts in Wordpress.
N.B. The class name is somewhat a misnomer because it can also represent a Capitulary file.

docblock.description: The filesystem path to the manuscript file.
The section of the manuscript, eg. 'mss', 'capit/ldf', .
The xml:id of the manuscript. Cached.
The title of the manuscript. Cached.

tag.description: The full path to the manuscript file

tag.name: return
tag.description: The slug with path, eg. capit/ldf/slug

docblock.description: Generate a HTML link that points to the page.
docblock.long-description: A link the user can click to get to the relative page.

docblock.description: Get the xml:id of this manuscript.
Get the title of this manuscript.
Get the current status of a manuscript page.
Extract the manuscript id and title.
docblock.long-description:
Extracts the manuscript id and title from the TEI file. We need the id for the post metadata. We need the title for the file list table.
Also puts qTranslate-X tags into the title iff the title has an xml:lang attribute.

docblock.description: Delete all pages with our slug
docblock.long-description:
Slugs must be unique for all children of one page, but the same slug may be used by more than one page provided each has a different parent page. Eg. /mss and /internal/mss both have the slug 'mss' but a different parent page, so we must account for that.
We also delete all pages that have the same slug with a hyphen and number appended. Eg. deleting the page /mss/my-slug would also delete the pages /mss/my-slug-1 and /mss/my-slug-42, but not the page /internal/mss/my-slug.

docblock.description: Create a page containing one or more shortcodes.
docblock.long-description: Build the content for the new page. Some pages are made of more than one transformation, eg. the transcription pages have a header, transcription and footer.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Status to set on the newly created page.

docblock.description: Perform an action on the manuscript.
docblock.long-description: Actions: publish: create the page with publish status private: create the page with private status refresh: re-create the page with the same status as before delete: delete the page

tag.name: param
tag.description: The action to perform with the manuscript.

tag.name: return

docblock.description: Plugin Name: Capitularia Pre-Print Plugin URI: Description: Generates previews of external HTML files.
docblock.long-description:
Version: 0.1.0 Author: Marcello Perathoner Author URI: License: GPLv2 or later Text Domain: cap-pre-print Domain Path: /languages
Capitularia Pre-Print Plugin
The *Pre-Print plugin* lets administrators preview HTML files generated from TEI files before publishing them.
The TEI files are :ref:`transformed into HTML files <html-generation-overview>` on the Capitularia VM. On that server we maintain up-to-date python and java installations. A customary Web Projekt at uni-koeln.de does not include those or includes outdated versions of them.
This plugin also stores the included text into the Wordpress database. This makes the built-in Wordpress search function work with the included material.
.. note:: Currently (Nov. 2019) the plugin also does some post-processing of the HTML files. This code will also be rewritten and moved to the VM.
The format of the shortcode is:
.. code::
[cap_include path="path/to/file.html" post="true"]
:param str path: Path of the file to include, relative to the root on the settings page. :param str post: Optional. If the included file should be post-processed by the footnotes-post-processor then set this parameter to true.
See also: the :ref:`Page Generator plugin <page-generator>`, which generates batches of page stubs from directories of TEI files. Those stubs usually contain the shortcodes for this plugin.

docblock.description: The Text Domain of the plugin.
The Wordpress ID of the settings (option) page.

docblock.long-description:
One difficulty is to get in early enough so that the qtranslate-x plugin has not translated away the unwanted languages. We need all languages to be there when we have to save the page. qtranslate-x hooks into 'the_posts' so we must too. The other difficulty is to protect the included content from the wpautop and wptexturizer filters, which were implemented with boundless incompetence and try to put

's around the included content everywhere and fuck up the HTML attributes with curly quotes. To get around those filters we insert 

 tags around the included content,
which is the only way to fend those filters off for some portion of a page,
instead of disabling them wholesale.  We double the 
 tags in this way:

...
 so that we can filter them out again later without
danger of removing tags of other provenience.

We have to save the included content to the database to make it searchable by
the built-in Wordpress search engine.

docblock.description: Do we have to save the post?
A ref to the post being processed.
Process our shortcodes. Step 1: Include the file.
docblock.long-description: Called very early from on_the_posts ().

tag.name: return
tag.description: The content to insert into the shortcode.

docblock.long-description: Called after wpautop and wptexturizer did their nefarious work. Clean up the <pre> tags we inserted only to protect against them.

We are forced to hook into 'the_posts' because the qtranslate-x plugin does it this way and we must get in before qtranslate-x has `translated´ away the unwanted languages.
We cannot save inside the on_shortcode_early hook because there may be more than one shortcode on the page and besides there may be other content too.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The array of posts with our shortcode processed.

docblock.long-description: Found in Wordpress admin under :menuselection:`Settings | Capitularia File Includer`.

Add option fields so we can use the Wordpress function do_settings_sections() to output them.
Also register *one* POST parameter to be handled and validated by Wordpress. We want all user entries to be returned into PHP as *one* string array called *OPTIONS_PAGE_ID*. This array will be passed by Wordpress to the validation function and stored in the database all in *one* row.

tag.name: see
tag.description: Blog post: how to store all plugin options into one database row.

tag.name: throws
tag.description: if the provided argument is not of type 'array'.

docblock.description: Output the root option field with its description.
Output the shortcode option field with its description.
Sanitize a field that should contain a path.

docblock.long-description: We get all user entries back in one associative array so that we can store them in one database row. This makes validation somewhat more difficult.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Array of key, value: the options as entered on the form.

docblock.long-description: The main difficulty here is to get around the wpautop and wptexturizer filters that were implemented with boundless incompetence.

tag.description: The content surrounded by shortcodes and <pre> tags.

docblock.description: Strip <pre> tags from around the content.

tag.description: The class or function name without namespace

tag.name: param
tag.description: Old classes added by Wordpress or other plugins.

docblock.description: Add private/draft/future/pending pages to page parent dropdown.
docblock.long-description: Only public pages are eligible for parenting in vanilla Wordpress. We want other pages also.

docblock.description: Translate the archive widget month names
Canonicalize the innumerable different ways the editors write a BK or Mordek no.
docblock.long-description:
Accepts (not exhaustive list of examples found in the wild):
BK.42 BK.042 BK_42 BK_042 bk-nr-42 bk-nr-042 Mordek.27 Mordek_27 mordek-nr-27 ldf/all-of-the-above
Returns:
bk-nr-042 mordek-nr-27

docblock.description: Get the Capitular page url corresponding to a BK or Mordek No.
docblock.long-description: This function figures out which subdirectory the Capitular page is in, eg. pre814/ or ldf/ or post840/ ...

tag.name: return
tag.description: The url to the page, eg. "http://.../capit/pre814/bk-nr-042a" or null

docblock.description: Get the manuscript page url corresponding to a manuscript siglum.
docblock.long-description: Note: If the siglum is not unique, a random manuscript with that siglum will be returned.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The path to the page, eg. "/mss/bamberg-sb-can-7" or null

docblock.long-description:
Examples of implemented redirects:
/capit/BK.42a => /capit/<subdir>/bk-nr-042a/ /capit/Mordek_27 => /capit/<subdir>/mordek-nr-27/ /bk/42a => /capit/<subdir>/bk-nr-042a/ /mordek/27 => /capit/<subdir>/mordek-nr-27/ /siglum/Ba2 => /mss/bamberg-sb-can-7

tag.name: param
tag.description: (unused) Whether or not to parse the request.

docblock.long-description: Define actions for various shortcodes.

This shortcode outputs its content only to logged-in users.
.. code::
[logged_in]You are logged in![/logged_in]

tag.name: return
tag.description: The shortcode content if logged in else the empty string.

docblock.long-description:
This shortcode outputs its content only to logged-out users.
.. code::
[logged_out]Please log in![/logged_out]

tag.name: return
tag.description: The shortcode content if logged out else the empty string.

docblock.long-description: This shortcode wraps the content in a link to the image server if the user is logged in.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The shortcode content wrapped in a link.

docblock.description: Make sure the status of a page is in the cache.
docblock.long-description: Some pages with long lists must check the status of hundreds of other pages. Wordpress turns each status check into one SQL query. This function reads the statuses of all children of a parent page in one SQL query, potentially saving hundreds of queries.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The path of the page without leading or trailing slashes.

tag.name: return
tag.description: A dictionary of path => status which is guaranteed to contain the page's status if the page exists.

docblock.description: Find out the status of a page.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The shortocde attributes. status = status, path = path of page

docblock.description: Cache a list of all manuscripts with a transcription of capitular cap_id

docblock.long-description:
This shortcode outputs its content if the ms. has that status. .. code:: [if_status path="/mss/wien" status="publish"]

Wien is published!

[/if_status]

tag.name: param
tag.description: The shortocde attributes. status = status, path = path of page

tag.name: return
tag.description: The shortcode content if the ms. has that status else the empty string.

docblock.long-description:
This shortcode outputs its content if the ms. doesn't have that status. .. code:: [if_not_status path="/mss/wien" status="publish"]

Wien is not published!

[/if_not_status]

tag.name: param
tag.description: The shortocde attributes. status = status, path = path of page

tag.name: return
tag.description: The shortcode content if the ms. doesn't have that status else the empty string.

docblock.description: Check if the current user can see a page.
docblock.long-description: Check if the user's permissions are sufficient to see a particular page.

tag.name: return
tag.description: if the current user can see the page.

docblock.long-description:
This shortcode outputs its content if the current user can see *any* one of the pages in the path attribute. .. code:: [if_visible path="/mss/secret.html"]
The secret manuscript.
[/if_visible] Use this with multiple pages to find out when to print headers, etc. .. code:: [if_any_visible path="/mss/leo1.html /mss/leo2.html"]

Hic sunt leones

[/if_any_visible]

tag.name: param
tag.description: The shortocde attributes. path = space separated paths of pages

tag.name: return
tag.description: The shortcode content if the user can see the page in path or else the empty string.

docblock.long-description:
This shortcode outputs its content if the current user cannot see *any* one of the pages in the path attribute. .. code:: [if_not_visible path="/premium.html"]

Pay to see our boring premium content!

[/if_not_visible]

tag.name: param
tag.description: The shortocde attributes. path = space separated paths of pages

tag.name: return
tag.description: The shortcode content if the current user cannot see the page in path else the empty string.

docblock.long-description: This shortcode outputs its content if the capitular was already transcribed in the manuscript with the xml:id. .. code:: [if_transcribed ms_id="barcelona-aca-ripoll" cap_id="BK.42"] and here[/if_transcribed]

tag.name: return
tag.description: The shortcode content if the corresp is transcribed, else the empty string.

docblock.long-description:
This shortcode outputs the current date using the preferred date representation for the current locale without the time. .. code::

Accessed on: [current_date]

yields: .. code::

Accessed on: Jan 1, 1970

This shortcode outputs the permalink for the current page. .. code::

URL: [permalink]

yields: .. code::

URL: https://example.org/post/123

This shortcode outputs a short description of how to cite the post. .. code::

[cite_as]

tag.name: return
tag.description: A description of how to cite.

docblock.long-description: Register the sidebars for various page types.

docblock.description: Capitularia Theme Archive Navigation Menu Widget
A navigation menu widget for a custom archives menu.
docblock.long-description: To display the post archives with our custom dynamic menu we need to have the list of archives somewhere in the HTML page for the menu to grab. This wrapper injects that list into the HTML page inside a hidden block and then lets the menu do its thing.

docblock.description: Capitularia Theme Categories Navigation Menu Widget
A navigation menu widget for a custom categories menu.
docblock.long-description: To display the post categories with our custom dynamic menu we need to have the list of categories somewhere in the HTML page for the menu to grab. This wrapper injects that list into the HTML page inside a hidden block and then lets the menu do its thing.
